itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer (1894-1969)

wikipedia_page.main: Benjamin Beynon (14 March 1894 – 21 May 1969) was a Welsh international rugby union fly-half who played club rugby for Swansea, and would later play professional rugby league for Oldham RLFC (Heritage № 215). Beynon was also an association footballer for Swansea Town.

response: The club's first professional match was a 1–1 draw at the Vetch Field against Cardiff City on 7 September 1912. During that first season the Welsh Cup was won for the first time. The Swans beat reigning English champions Blackburn Rovers 1–0 in the first round of the 1914–15 FA Cup, Swansea's goal coming from Ben Beynon.
*21 May – Ben Beynon, Welsh rugby union international and Swansea Town player, 75
*14 March – Ben Beynon, Welsh rugby union international and Swansea Town player (died 1969)
*Ben Beynon (1894-1969), Welsh international rugby player and professional football player
